affinity.help: Enable/disable affinity, attaching a source-ip's traffic to the assigned forwarding server until the forward-server-affinity-timeout is reached (under web-proxy global).
affinity.name: affinity

group-down-option.help: Action to take when all of the servers in the forward server group are down: block sessions until at least one server is back up or pass sessions to their destination.
group-down-option.name: group-down-option

options.help: Block sessions until at least one server in the group is back up.
options.name: block

options.help: Pass sessions to their destination bypassing servers in the forward server group.
options.name: pass

ldb-method.help: Load balance method: weighted or least-session.
ldb-method.name: ldb-method

options.help: Load balance traffic to forward servers based on assigned weights. Weights are ratios of total number of sessions.
options.name: weighted

options.help: Send new sessions to the server with lowest session count.
options.name: least-session

options.help: Send new sessions to the next active server in the list. Servers are selected with highest weight first and then in order as they are configured. Traffic switches back to the first server upon failure recovery.
options.name: active-passive

name.help: Configure a forward server group consisting one or multiple forward servers. Supports failover and load balancing.
name.name: name

weight.help: Optionally assign a weight of the forwarding server for weighted load balancing (1 - 100, default = 10)
weight.name: weight

server-list.help: Add web forward servers to a list to form a server group. Optionally assign weights to each server.
server-list.name: server-list

results.help: Configure a forward server group consisting or multiple forward servers. Supports failover and load balancing.
results.name: forward-server-group
